group_1.textCenter: | You can draw Ui with the ketchup. |

group_1.textLeft: You're so good! You're like a precision machine!

group_1.textRight: Where in the world did you learn this sort@of skill...

group_1.textLeft: | While I was with Ryo, Ikumi taught me... |

group_1.textRight: It's your most favoritest maid, Kumi!@A.k.a. Ikumi Makino!
If you want to master the art of ketchup,@I'll teach you! ♪
[flashEffect:flashWhite1][chara:304301:effect_shake]*Baddum!*

group_1.textLeft: | This *Baddum* is how I've been taught. |

group_1.textRight: The world is truly full of unknowns...

group_1.textCenter: That's right, my father is being transferred for@his job and we're moving away.
I feel sorry towards Asuka, but I can only go@to the Ryushinkan Dojo for a few more days.

group_1.textLeft: You've come a long way, I really appreciate it!

group_1.textRight: It's the last request from my Master, after all.

group_1.textLeft: | Asuka's student...why...? |
| Are you here to say goodbye...? |

group_1.textRight: No, actually, I thought I'd drop by after@hearing your story.
I told you that I was leaving the Ryushinkan@Dojo, and made you terrified of separation.
So I just wanted to let you know that I'm not@sad or lonely.

group_1.textLeft: | Parting is lonely... |

group_1.textRight: It's true that she'll be leaving the Ryushinkan@Dojo.
But the time we've spent studying together and@the skills we've honed will stay with each other.
The bond between those who have walked the@path of martial arts together is not easily erased.

group_1.textLeft: | It won't disappear... |

group_1.textRight: And for my part, I'm excited, because the next@time we meet, we'll be opponents.

group_1.textLeft: That's right.
We won't have the chance to meet often, so@we'll see each other's growth through matches.
So, from now on...
We will form a new bond as those competing@on the path of martial arts!

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's right!

group_1.textLeft: It's not like we're saying goodbye forever, and@we're actually looking forward to it.

group_1.textCenter: (The relationship changes, but new bonds are@formed...)

group_1.textRight: Tamakiiii! Ui Tamakiiii!
Good afternoon!

group_1.textCenter: But if you know her, well, you know...
Please keep it a secret that I'm leaving the@school.

group_1.textLeft: It's my teacher! Why are you here?

group_1.textRight: I heard that you and your friends were here,@you know.
I often come here to see the cherry blossoms,@you know.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, really!
Thank you so much for coming all the way here!

group_1.textRight: Actually, I've been wondering when I should@tell Ui.
If someone is suffering because of me, I want@to make things right, you know?
So, I'm glad I had the opportunity.

group_1.textLeft: | Because of what you told me...? |

group_1.textRight: I'm sorry for the strange request I made to@keep it a secret back then.
But, you know, I've decided to tell her.

group_1.textLeft: H-huh...? What do you want to tell me...?

group_1.textRight: Actually, I'm being transferred to another@school soon.

group_1.textLeft: Another school...?
Does that mean I won't be able to see you@anymore...?!

group_1.textRight: It will certainly be difficult for a few years, but@you'll grow up and be able to ride the train freely.
When you're ready to play elsewhere, you can@meet me any time!

group_1.textLeft: But, I was only able to fit in because of you...

group_1.textRight: You know, Ui, you can fly freely even if I'm@not here.
You're just a little shy, but you could make@friends with anybody.

group_1.textLeft: Really...?

group_1.textRight: You've been growing little by little, you know?
I've seen it, so trust me.
Besides, my care for you will be passed on@to the next teacher.

group_1.textLeft: Passed on?

group_1.textRight: Yes, even if I'm no longer around, my care@for you will be inherited!
So don't worry about it.

group_1.textLeft: Okay...

group_1.textRight: And I'll be looking forward to seeing you@from the next school.
I can't wait to see you all grown up.

group_1.textLeft: ...I understand.
I won't let anxiety get the better of me, and@I'll definitely see you one day!
So, get ready to be surprised the next time@you see me!

group_1.textRight: I've got more things to look forward to@in the future now, you know.

group_1.textCenter: (The teacher's thoughts were left behind, still@remaining connected.)
(By parting, there'll be more to look forward to@in the future...)

group_1.textRight: What a GREAT idea!!

group_1.narration: —Manaka—@It's a new dessert based on@Walnut's classic cherry blossom cookies!
—Manaka—@The previous product is gone, but the tradition of the@cherry blossom desserts are alive and well!
—Tsumugi—@I'm so happy, I feel like I'm gonna faint...!
—Himika—@Th-th-this work of art...@If I eat this, won't I face divine punishment?!
—Eternal Sakura—@(I thought the cookies were gone,@but now they're back in another form...)

group_1.textLeft: | .........[chara:304301:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:304301:cheek_0][chara:304301:face_mtn_ex_011.exp.json][chara:304301:lipSynch_1]Iroha. |

group_1.textRight: Hm?

group_1.textLeft: | When the cherry blossoms bloom, will many@things happen besides farewells...? |

group_1.textRight: Yeah.
Sometimes you have to part ways, and@sometimes you get to meet new people.
If your current teacher goes to another school,@you'll meet a new teacher.
Some people move away when spring comes,@some people move in.
When the cherry blossoms bloom, even though@there are many goodbyes...
It's how we meet so many people.

group_1.textLeft: | I see... |
| There are many kinds of goodbyes? |

group_1.textRight: That's right, not just sad goodbyes.
There are times when parting is a new start@for us.
Sakurako, Yachiyo said this:
Spring is the season of change, when the@plants and animals come alive.
She said that's why there are so many@changes.
I believe that, too.
I'm sure it's because everything becomes@more colorful and begins to nurture new life.
Our relationships with each other will take on@new forms, just like today.

group_1.narration: | My time is slower than others. |
| However, everyone was walking past me so quickly@that I became afraid. |
| If I spend all my time trying to catch up with them,@I won't be able to recognize the meaning in their goodbye. |
| To Uwasa, it's merely a farewell. |
| I'll teach everyone else@that it's okay to let the cherry blossoms bloom,@and that goodbyes aren't all sad. |

group_1.textCenter: It doesn't seem like you would ever change,@even after hundreds of years.
(If gods exist, perhaps they'd be just like me.)
(People live so fast, we wonder if we'll be left@behind.)
